alert.note: Alert for Bucks; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 27 at 9:33PM EDT until June 27 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Bucks County in southeastern Pennsylvania... East Central Montgomery County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Northeastern Philadelphia County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 1145 PM EDT. * At 933 PM EDT, The heavy rain that fell across the area has ended, but flash flooding continues. The Pennypack Creek remains above flood stage, but has crested and is subsiding. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Philadelphia, Bensalem, Abington, Bryn Athyn, Northeast Philadelphia, Feasterville-Trevose, Feasterville, Willow Grove, Churchville, and Cornwells Heights-Eddington. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 345 and 353. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
